1.content:
Oh Malcolm Taylor. You're generally nice, but not a perfect angel. You're a fifth year Ravenclaw Hogwarts student. You're pretty bright, afterall, that's why you're in Ravenclaw. Throughout your studying, you noticed an annoying little flaw. There are two shrinking charms, Reducio and Diminuendo. But the problem is, Reducio only works as the counterpart to Engorgio, it can only shrink something back to normal size after it has been enlarged by Engorgio. And Diminuendo can shrink objects to smaller than their original size, but doesn't work on living things. You wanted to bridge this gap, and be credited for creating the most useful shrinking spell, far superior to the other two shrinking charms due to their limitations. But you're not simply using a spell, you're creating one. Sometimes using spells can be dangerous, as it can go awry. But you're dealing with untamed magic, forcing it to bend to your will and making it bound to a word (or words) of power. This is especially difficult and highly dangerous for inexperienced witches and wizards. And here you are, not even graduated from the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, trying just that. Boy, for being a Ravenclaw sometimes you sure can do some idiotic things.

And whaddya know, in the midst of your first attempt, the magic surges, not ready to bend to your will so easily, and due to your inexperience with raw magic, it handles you easily. Your wand explodes from this surge of power, and the explosion of light shrinks anything near you...especially you.

You feel a little woozy for a few moments, and when you look around everything is downright massive. You feel great joy at first, for the fact that even though you didn't actually succeed in creating the spell, for the fact that the magic shrunk things that means you were on the right track. But then you start to fully realize your predicament. Your wand exploded. You can't use magic. You're very tiny, maybe only an inch tall. And even if you can get someone to help you, Engorgio can't make something as small as you as big as you once were. You're completely, utterly, stuck like this. Now the question is...where did you perform this?

"This has to be some kind of nightmare", you think to yourself. You imagined being underneath these canopies of flesh would not be the most pleasant experience - but this?
Knowing fully well what needs to be done, you start sobbing quietly, while pushing your hand further between your unaware captors second and third toes.
Digging your hand in, you continued digging in, making sure to rub the stinky, sweaty material upon the sole in front of you, while not looking. You dug, and dug, and dug - and at some point, thought this torture would never end...

Until it did.
You felt something else. Beneath all these layers of cheese, finally, there was something else. Getting up on your knees, you pushed your head into the crevice, some leftover cheese sticking to your hair and clothes. But there, you saw it - a piece of skin, larger than your head. In contrast with the rest of the foot, this piece of skin had kind of a reddish color to it, making it obvious it was softer than the rest of Harmione's foot, since it was protected by all the cheese surrounding it.
Reaching your hand towards it, you touch it. And start gently tickling it with your fingers, expecting some kind of response in return to your efforts. Your nimble fingers dug into the skin, rubbing faster, vaster motions.. Rubbing, rubbing, rubbing with all of your tiny strength..

But the response never came.
You tried rubbing again, and again. And tears started streaming down your eyes. All of your effort, the disgust you had to pull through, everything that has happened up to this point.. All, for nothing. "This won't be my tomb, I won't let it end like this!", you say in anger, but before you could even do something.. You feel a shift in position.
The toes started to flatten against the stone tiles. The entire arch flattening against the cold floor, giving it a pinkish-whitish color instead of it's usual brown pink, making it obvious the giant magician has only one plan in mind.
Feeling the warmth radiating from her feet, she wants to rub them against the cold floor once again.

Seeing the ceiling of flesh suddenly dropping down on you, you understood you had very little time to decide. The gap between her toes was closing, and fast, it's piece of exposed skin waving you, and your chances of escape, goodbye.
You had to act now.

You squeeze yourself through her toes, and find you have no place for your hands in there. Only your torso could barely fit in, as it is. You look frantically in every direction, trying to think about a course of action as the toes close in for the kill, and understand you have no other choice.
Reaching in with your face, you begin licking the soft skin with your tongue. At first, when you taste the skin, the sweat drops that has been forming all around it, the tiny bits of cheese that was left over, you had to keep yourself from throwing up. But knowing full well what stopping meant, it took every ounce of strength within you to continue.
The toes continued to zoom in, every bit of light disappearing from up above. Oxygen levels reaching a new low, and don't get me even started on the heat that was forming all around you, but just before the end..
The toes stop. The entire foot stops at once, and you stop licking as well. Looking up above you, you could barely see anyhing, other than the tomb of flesh that was trying to seal you. But you squeezed your eyes, and tried your best.
And there, from in between the petite toes - you could just make it: The gigantic face of your goddess, looking right at the crevice you've been molesting. Opening up your mouth, coughing and spluttering foot gunk, you yell at her: "Harmione! Please! Down here!!!".
When suddenly, the sky turn dark all at once.

Uh oh...

You bounce around in your little container in Hermione's pocket as she heads to who knows where. You can't see anything inside her pocket and you can't hear anything from inside the vial, so you're just plain sensory-deprived until Hermione takes you from your prison.
How could this have gone so wrong? All you wanted was to deliver a simple "Hello, I'm tiny, please help," and now to her you're a bug for spell practice. What, is Murphy's Law hanging around over your head like a black cloud? You take a seat (an uncomfortable one, at that) in your small glass prison while being rhythmically jostled up and down from her walking. It's positively irritating but there's nothing you can do.

Maybe ten or fifteen minutes later, you feel the walking stop and you are blinded by the light of the outside world. Not really, as the Gryffindor girl's dorm isn't all that bright and you're not really outside, just outside the giant genius's pocket. Hermione sets you on her desk and observes you for a moment, clearly detesting your existence. She looks uncertain, then flicks her wand a couple of times and Pop! goes the cork and out you tumble, being pulled by magic. A blue light sparks out from her wand and hits you, rendering you immobile for the time being.
"I wonder what I could try on you," she ponders, scratching her chin. "What about...a durability spell? That way, if I squash you, you'll live," she says, brown eyes staring intently, "Not that I want you to live, but if I want to perform tests on you it wouldn't work out well if I accidentally killed you premature."
She nods, then twirls her wand at you, a purple light engulfing you and making you feel tingly all over. Her eyes study you a moment, and she nods definitively.
"There, that should be working. Let's try," she said before knocking you onto the floor with her wand. It was uncomfortable enough falling from the height to the floor, but you just about peed yourself when she brought her sneaker over you, blotting out the light overhead and her face. You had not even a moment to blink before the shoe crashed down upon your body, squashing you like...well like exactly what she thought you was--a bug. She grinded her foot on top of you, causing you intense pain, but not killing you. She made you practically invulnerable! You weren't positive, but you thought there was an easy way to take away your pain too, but of course she wouldn't do that. Sigh.

What will she try next?

12133212.content: Hermione pauses, moves her foot away from your body, then does some sort of breathing exercise to calm herself down. You don't move a muscle...because you can't. Though honestly, after that experience, you're not sure you would have anyway. Finally, she opens her eyes and looks down at you. "Don't think you're getting out of this." She turns toward the pile of broken glass on the floor, and with a wave of her wand, the glass all reassembles into the shape of a vial, without so much as a scratch, and lands gracefully in her hand. Again, she uncorks it. She leans down, picks you up, and slides you into the vial. She casts the same spell as before, so you don't suffocate to death. She then smiles at you. For a moment, it's a proud smile. One that shows she got over her anger without killing you, one that shows that she has acquired something particularly useful to her studies all on her own. Then it's a malicious smile. One that displays her contempt for bugs, one that implies she may do things to you simply because she can, and not particularly because it would be helpful whatsoever to her studies. Before you can read more into it, Hermione places you and the vial back into her pocket, and in total darkness.

121332121.content:
When Hermione pulled you out again, she unceremoniously dumped you into a little bowl. She did a quick courtesy of making you indestructible ("for later" she had said) and then turned away. As you cowered and shivered in the bottom, you saw your apathetic captor reading from a book. A book of advanced Transfiguration. Oh no... You had spent countless hours poring over that specific book while you were making your spell. The majority of it was dedicated to basic creature-to-object Transfiguration. By the point she at in the book, she couldn't do much in the way of size; it was small animals into small, simple objects. Mice into clothes, that sort of thing. Nothing of consequence to a normal-sized wizard. But then, you weren't normal-sized, were you?

Your train of thought was interrupted by Hermione putting her book down with a note of finality you didn't like and turning towards you. When she spoke, it was in a self-reflective tone directed at nobody in particular. "Well, then, I have two other spells I'd like to work on... could turn it into some panties... or food..."

Suddenly, the brunette decided and pointed her wand at you. A blue jet of light came rushing towards you. You closed your eyes...

...and opened them. The spell had hit, yes, but you were somehow alive. And cold... Of course! It had hit your cloak! You were free! But when you tried to move, you realized you couldn't move anything. Something (either bread or fabric) had wound its way around and across you -- you were stuck! Again! Then you felt a brief sensation of weightlessness as the witch grabbed her Transfiguration and brought it in front of her face. The brown filter of what was once your cloak gave way to successively lighter shades, before you were finally revealed to the world and saw...

1223212.content: Due to the high ledge of the flat and your lack of upper body strength, you find yourself quite unable to breach the side. After several minutes of your pathetic attempts at trying to pull your diminutive weight over the ledge, Ginny giggles. "Need some help, little guy?" she asks, finding your struggles amusing. Your face immediately burns red as she asks you this. As if it wasn't bad enough that you were climbing into her rank shoe, but now she's decided you're not good enough to do it on your own and has to help you. Poor, helpless little Malcolm. You shake your head, positive you'll pull it off eventually. She lets out a puff of air and says, "Oh don't be stubborn. Here, let me help." And with that, you see her black sock-clad foot glide over and hover above you. You hardly have time to marvel at how just her foot dwarfs you in size as her toes lower on top of you and smash you into the ground. Pushing you into the ground in order to get a better grip, her toes wrap around you as far as they can and squeeze you into the ball of foot. Deciding the worst part of the situation is difficult, whether it be the terrible smell emanating from her sock, the damp fabric that you know without a doubt is from sweat, or the fact that your tiny adventure has only managed to land you in the vice grip of a young student's toes. Satisfied that her toes have a good enough grip on you, she lifts her foot a little, making sure you won't fall. "Gotcha, little guy. In you go!" she says, almost cutely. Definitely not cute from her toe grip. Without further adieu, she slides her foot into her flat. Once it's all the way on, she lets her toes rest and drop you onto the insole. If you thought her sock smelled bad by itself, then you had another thing coming when it was inside her shoe. The air was musty, the floor was grimy and damp, and it was all just so humid and smelly. Her sock clad toes rest on top of you, lightly pushing you into her insole. Unable to resist her powerful appendages, you have no choice but to let her toes play with you in any such manner. From outside the shoe, Ginny smiles as her pet is in place.

Luna's hand opens up and the jerk that gravity is just pulls you right into the putrid shoe. The second you hit the bottom, you can feel the humidity difference. It's so muggy in here. Luna walks around for a while, going from class to class, constantly squeezing you between her toes. The motion of walking is sickening (as if the smell wasn't bad enough), and you really wish she wouldn't shake her foot so much when she crosses her legs. But you are powerless in the confines of her shoe, imprisoned between her two unsocked toes.

You felt yourself getting hungry, which must mean it's very close to noon, because your stomach is always right on time. Luna must have noticed the time too, because she leaned down and told you what you're allowed to eat. "Hey little Zimboggler, it's lunch time! I bet you're super hungry. Okay, well, I hadn't mentioned this yet, but as my captive Zimboggler, you get a very unique diet. It's definitely not people food, because that would of course strengthen you, and possibly allow you to give me nightmares. So that's out of the question. I've decided that for the purpose of keeping you submitted, that the best diet for you is to drink my foot sweat and eat my toe jam. Oh and if you're lucky, you can eat some dead skin that flakes off my foot, isn't that great?" she asks excitedly, and even though you can't see her through the shoe you can tell she's innocently smiling. If only she knew what she was doing to you...

Well, will you submit and eat your planned diet? Or will you bite her foot to get her attention, and if she takes you out will you try to tell her what you need?
12311111.title: Luna instructs you of your diet while living in...

choices: Luna decides to throw you a bone, tossing some cauldron cake in her shoe

123111111.content:
You tried to ignore the ultimatum Luna gave you (that being eat the crud from her foot or starve to death), but it seemed like fate was against you. Even in the grasp of her moist, writhing toes, surrounded by the horrid reek of unwashed feet, you felt your stomach growl. You'd think the stench would make you too nauseous to consider eating, but on the contrary, the potent, cheddary scent, though mixed in with other foul hints of worn leather and faded perfume, only deepened your hunger. Your metabolic clock, while often useful, has now become your worst enemy. You were practically starving! Not to mention that you were quite parched, too; what with the briny, salt-infused atmosphere sucking all the moisture out of your mouth. Sooner or later, you would have to nut up and bite the bullet—or in this case, Luna's foot.

---

As Luna went about her daily routine, you were made painfully aware of the dilapidated state of her converse. They were so worn down that, at one point, the lip of the shoe ripped just a tiny bit, barely allowing a bit of light into your shoe prison. Even though the light relieved you of sensory deprivation, you honestly preferred the darkness; at least there you weren't forced to gaze into the abyss that was the gunk-filled toe crevice in front of you. You look down, occasionally catching glances at your own body; your wizarding robes were in tatters, doused in sweat, and covered in grime. They're already falling apart at the seams; you shudder to think of how they'd hold up under much more of this kind of stress, and how long you've been in this truly revolting piece of footwear.

Finally, as she sits down for a moment, you feel your thirst reach a fever pitch. Your lips are chapped to hell and back, your mouth is as dry as a desert, and you're sure above all else that if you didn't do something to relieve the ache in your throat right now, you would perish. You turn your head and regretfully crane your neck towards the side of the second toe, open your mouth, and suck.

Instantly, a sharp, salty tang washes over your mouth, the dreaded concoction coating your tongue completely as you lick the surface of the titanic toe. This is followed by a concentrated punch of flavor from the miniscule clumps of dirt, dead skin, and dried sweat that inevitably fell through your lips. The spells Luna used must have been very powerful, because you could feel fresh rivulets of the vile liquid pouring into your mouth just as quickly as you lapped it up. And lap it up you did; you really underestimated how thirsty this awful humidity made you. Despite your disgust, you downed the live-giving sweat like it was the nectar of the gods. It was as if you were put on auto-pilot. The taste was almost indescribable; you could barely hold back a gag. You told yourself that it was all for the sake of survival, but as the contents of your 'drink' trickle down your esophagus, never-ending, you can't help but think it's just another game you'll 'play' with Luna in the eternity you'll spend in her beat-up converse, being a play-toy for her sweaty, musky, and unbelievably grimy feet. The taste, though, was getting more tolerable, a thought that shocked you to your core.

You try to justify it to yourself. Like with those films with people stranded on lifeless islands, you have to adapt to your environment, and come to view this awful torture as normal, and this terrible 'water' as a sign of hope. You were dehydrated, so naturally, any source of water would be enjoyable, even the days-old (or god-knows how long since she washed her damn feet) footsweat of a ditzy, dreamy witch-in-training.

You can't say the same about your 'food', however; as you purse your lips around the toe flesh, chewing slightly, but not enough to hurt, slight flakes of dried sweat and dead toe skin scrape off into your mouth, renewing the potent smack all over again, every time it happens. As you continue this method, you eventually make your way towards the deep recesses of Luna's toe crevices. Your stomach still rumbling, you realize that you have no choice but to stick your face in and eat the toe jam straight from the source. The first bite makes everything you've experienced in this hellish shoe seem small in comparison; it was like some horrific, elaborately cooked meal—there were tastes of dead grass, leather, and flesh, all thrown together in a sweat-based stock that complemented the other ingredients in a terrible symphony of feet. Still, you had to eat it; after all, there was nothing else in here you could subsist off of. And so, you bit off and swallowed down pieces of the gooey mass between the toes that squeezed you, sating your hunger—not that you could tell, considering that it might just as well be nausea rather than the feeling of a full belly.

---

Throughout all this, Luna felt every little movement, lick, and bite that you made. She was content with your work as she finished off a delicious cauldron cake her father got for her from Qizilbash. It might've been a bit too much of a dessert to eat at lunchtime, but she felt pretty proud of herself for catching such a rare creature

"Maybe I don't have to be rid of this Zimboggler after all...he's a pretty useful toe-cleaner."

She then remembered the catchphrase on the package her sweet came in: "Great for sharing!" As she contemplated it, she felt a bit bad about the little thing in her shoes. Even if it was foul work it was doing, it might not deserve this much torture; but should she risk it getting out, just to feed it?

12322.content:
Luna's giant blue eyes fill with delight when they focus on you.

"A little person!" she exclaims. Yes! This is exactly what you hoped to hear! She recognizes you are a person! Perfect. You excitedly wave your arms and shout for her attention. She smiles cutely and lets out a little giggle at your behavior.

"I've heard so much about students importing in tiny muggles to play with, never thought I'd find one myself!" she says with delight. Tiny muggle? No, that's not right.

It's true, that some students have smuggled in some tiny muggles to keep as pets. They're strictly forbidden, so they're kept a secret. Which isn't quite hard, considering their size. There have been some magical anomalies in different parts of the world that have caused hundreds of people to spontaneously shrink. The magical governments of the world did a great job at memory-replacing any muggles that knew about the shrunken people, but they have been unsuccessful at stopping the anomalies, and only partially successful at regrowing a select few muggles. It's quite a difficult and confusing process which appears to be different on a person-by-person basis. In fact, these anomalies are in part what you began your research into your spell on. Since the anomalies are so random and widespread, a lot of the tiny muggles are captured by others and kept before any governing entities can swoop in and save them. Which is exactly how so many find their way into the hands of students, if hidden well enough and paid a high enough price for.

Naturally, being assumed to be a tiny muggle is much worse than being recognized as a shrunken student. It could put you right into the degrading lifestyle of being the pet or plaything of a student here. But shouldn't Luna know you're a student by your attire?

"Aww, it's so cute how your owner dressed you in tiny Hogwarts robes. How adorable!" she says, cooing over you. Well...shoot, that's that. You try yelling up to her, but she either can't hear you or has no interest in listening.

"It's a shame someone lost you. I can't exactly put up 'found' posters, since you're contraband. Oh well," she says, her hand reaching down for you. Adrenaline kicks in and you're prepared to run for your life (as nice as Luna is, a giant hand reaching for you is terrifying no matter the circumstances), but it doesn't matter. Her fingers encase you before you make it as far as five steps. Being wrapped up in her fingers elicits a strange mix of feelings, both fearful and comforting. You're trapped, yet it is warm, and in the embrace of a person. You want free, but at the same time, her hand is so soft...

Upon realizing just how soothed you're feeling, you recognize a new fear: Are you enjoying all this? The warmth and safety of Luna's hand, her pretty, gentle face, and the rhythmic sway of her stride from inside her pocket... How long until you see her not as a peer in unusual circumstances, but actually as a superior being that might call herself your owner? Are you already taking on the mindset of a pet? Are you giving in that easily?

info.brief_description: In this fun tale you're a student at Hogwarts, but due to a spell gone wrong you shrink!
info.description:
Your name is Malcolm Taylor. You're not a very well known student at Hogwarts, and the main reason you're so behind-the-scenes is because you're just not the greatest at making friends. You're in Ravenclaw and you love magic. You're trying to invent your own spell, because you noticed that the shrinking charm Reducio can only be used to return an enlarged object (from Engorgio) back to its original size and Diminuendo cannot be used on living things, so you wanted to bridge that gap with a spell of your own, that could shrink anything. But you run into a bit of Neville-style bad luck and all this tempering with untamed magic causes your wand to explode, and it shrinks you and all the objects around you.

Rules:

Please, make an honest-to-God attempt at typing correctly. Typos happen, I know that, but some people type like they've never been to Elementary school. If I see typos I can try to fix it for you, but if you type so horribly that I can't comprehend what it is you were trying to say then I will either revise the chapter myself or, if I'm particularly lazy, delete it.

Don't be offensive. It's not hard to be not offensive. Malcolm isn't racist, sexist, etc. So don't try to make him that way.

Type in Second Person. (You do this, you do that. You're Malcolm Taylor, you suck at making spells. Etc)

Try to always give choices. I hate chapters where at the end it just says "Continue" as the only option. That takes the fun out of an interactive.


Okay, now, feet is preferred, but you don't HAVE to write feet chapters. Butt, breasts, armpits, I don't care. I'm just telling you I personally like feet and would love to see some feet chapters in here.

That should be about it. Have fun writing and reading!
